items.title: Dozens Locked in Hinds County’s Jails Without an Indictment — Some for Over a Year
items.description: The newly appointed federal receiver has asked the county’s district attorney to move more cases, while the DA has asked the county for more money.

items.title: In the Shadow of an Immigrant Detention Center, a Small House Offers Refuge
items.description: Amid rising ICE arrests, volunteers provide aid — a meal, a bed, gas money — to anyone visiting someone detained in remote rural Georgia.

items.title: Why New Orleans Became Trump’s Newest Immigration Target
items.description: Recent legal changes, a Trump-friendly governor and a large immigration detention infrastructure could make the New Orleans crackdown easier for the a...

items.title: In New York Prisons, Lack of Medical Care Led to Preventable Deaths
items.description: More than 30 people with dangerous but treatable ailments — infections, obstructed bowels and asthma attacks — died in the past decade.

items.title: An Overlooked Source of Information in Missouri Prison Deaths: The Coroner
items.description: When corrections officials aren’t forthcoming with records, coroners can offer families the details needed to find closure or pursue accountability.
